timeline.message:
Fix compilation error suggested by errorprone
Found some silly mistakes as well. :smile:

timeline.bodyText: I think we can remove this annotation rather than suppressing where it's used. 🤔
timeline.author: minwoox
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -96,7 +94,6 @@ default void write(Supplier o) { * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the publication of the specified object has been rejected * @see Life cycle of reference-counted objects */ - @CheckReturnValue

replies.bodyText:
I think it's much easier to have a bug because of not checking this return value, in almost all cases the user should specially handle a closed stream right?
For example, here it looks like we should actually be skipping the rest of the callback if the stream is already closed

  
    
      armeria/core/src/main/java/com/linecorp/armeria/server/healthcheck/HealthCheckService.java
    
    
         Line 332
      in
      4f62fc0
    
    
    
    

        
          
           res.tryWrite(ping);
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: Ah, that makes sense. Let me fix that. 😄
replies.author: minwoox

replies.bodyText: Found out that we can just call res.write(ping); there. 😆
replies.author: minwoox

timeline.author: trustin
trustin

replies.bodyText: Yeah, it's redundant but it seems that the Errorprone couldn't recognize and indicates this is an error. 😱
replies.author: minwoox

replies.bodyText: In Java 14 maybe it doesn't complain? :) But yeah seems like a false positive but harmless workaround
replies.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: These fluent assertion checks are awesome
timeline.author: anuraaga
